DataElement.preferredName: Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group CTCAE Term Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to capture adverse event term description(s) in the Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (VCOG-CTCAE) following chemotherapy or biological antineoplastic therapy in dogs and cats (v1.0, 2004).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group Adverse Event Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to the Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events following chemotherapy or biological antineoplastic therapy in dogs and cats (v1.0, 2004)

ObjectClass.preferredName: Veterinary Medicine Cooperative Group Program Adverse Event
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The practice of medicine as applied to non-human animals.:NCI-sponsored program that promotes and supports clinical trials in cancer treatment, (largely combined modality approaches); cancer prevention, and early detection within setting of a Cooperative Group.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: The practice of medicine as applied to non-human animals.

NCI-sponsored program that promotes and supports clinical trials in cancer treatment, (largely combined modality approaches); cancer prevention, and early detection within setting of a Cooperative Group.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts related to the treatment of veterinary subjects.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group CTCAE Term Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text terms to represent adverse event term descriptions included in the Veterinary Cooperative Oncology Group Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (VCOG-CTCAE) following chemotherapy or biological antineoplastic therapy in dogs and cats (v1.0, 2004).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts related to the treatment of veterinary subjects.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VCOG-CTCAE Criteria
ReferenceDocuments.description: Set of permissible terms available in URL or in Veterinary and Comparative Oncology, 2, 4, 194-213, 2004.
